intro: Alsine macrotheca, commonly known as the broad-leafed sandwort, is a flowering plant species native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is well adapted to drought conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Alsine macrotheca plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats and is often found in disturbed or open areas.
